description: Borrowed from Middle French occidental, from Latin occidentalis.

adjectives.description: occidental (comparative more occidental, superlative most occidental)

entries.meaning: Of, pertaining to, or situated in, the occident, or west; western. [from 16th c.]
examples: occidental climates, or customs; an occidental planet.

entries.meaning: Of a gem or precious stone: of inferior value or quality. [from 18th c.]
A Western Christian of the Latin rite
examples: Most occidentals resident in South China have joined the Chinese in their zealous enthusiasm for the lychee.
